title: Parsing BBCode
content:
BBCode is a cool markdown language. It is easy to learn and simple to use. Even better, you can add your own tags to the markup in your Django backend. Today, it is used in most forums because it is much safer and more controlled than HTML.

One day, I decided to try to parse it. After an hour of writing, the turnout was ok! I was quite happy with the result.
First, it converts the markup language to a list of text and tag names. Then it converts those to an abstract syntax tree.
I am pretty sure it supports all the features of BBCode, like [[]escaping] and [code] tags. It was also my first successful parser. I have many failed parsers sitting around for things like English, Scratch2 and even some data structures I designed. But they are a totally different story...
